title: Should Marvel Create A Marvel Cinematic Universe Comic Line?
text:
Should Marvel Create A Marvel Cinematic Universe Comic Line? Kofi Outlaw Start Slideshow Slide of 
The Marvel Cinematic Universe has become one of the biggest entities in entertainment, drawing fans and mainstream viewers alike into a world of superheroes and villains that stretch from the movie theater to television to any digital device that carries Netflix ( and soon Hulu as well). And yet, this wonderful web of interconnected stories and characters strangely does not extend to the deepest roots of the Marvel Universe: Marvel comic books. 
At this point, with so much legal confusion about how Marvel Comics should handle characters like the X-Men or Fantastic Four (whose movie and TV rights are owned by Fox), it's almost impossible for the main Marvel 616 comic book Universe to be redone in MCU form; however, Marvel Comics have a tradition of alternate realities and timelines, and wondering if it's time for one of those spinoff universes to be based on the MCU. 
In other words: Should Marvel Create A Marvel Cinematic Universe Comic Line?
